file.fileio



void add_mod_directory(string directory);
Add a mod directory (subdirectory of ./data/) to read data from.

Directories added later take precedence over directories added before, e.g., if we add 3 directories, "main", "mod1" and "mod2", file "file.txt" will be first searched for as "./data/mod2/file.txt", then "./data/mod1/file.txt" and finally "./data/main/file.txt"

If the directory name is invalid or the directory doesn't exist, an Exception is thrown. Only lowercase letters, numbers and the '' character are allowed in mod directory names.

File open_file(string name, FileMode mode);
Open a file with given name and mode.

Files are searched for in known ./data/ subdirectories, e.g. if "main" and "mod" are known subdirectories, file "file.txt" is first searched for in "./data/mod" and the "./data/main". Alternatively, subdirectory can be specified explicitly, e.g. "mod::file.txt" will always open "./data/mod/file.txt" . In case of an error, an Exception will be thrown. Reading a file that doesn't exist is an error. Also, file name for writing and appending must explicitly set mod directory (e.g. mod::file.txt).

void close_file(File file);
Close a file. This will write out any changes and delete any buffers.
